{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3569449,"name":"Ryan zheng","username":"Rzheng1232","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rzheng1232/{size}/182897_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T19:42:51.292Z","cooked":"

Hey guys,
we have a rev through bore encoder connected to the robo rio, but for some reason the relative values returned by the encoder are not reading correctly, staying at zero. I double checked the rio dio ports to make sure they were connected in the right channels and I also checked to make sure the absolute readings were behaving reasonably. Does anyone have any suggestions to why this might be? Here is a video showing the issue: https://youtube.com/shorts/7Y4TllzRQ6w?si=7AYNCYd0bSYDGLQQ For the code, I’m just using a the basic wpilibj Encoder object.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-03-26T19:42:51.292Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":60,"readers_count":59,"score":47.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":497027,"topic_slug":"some-troubles-with-reading-through-bore","display_username":"Ryan zheng","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://youtube.com/shorts/7Y4TllzRQ6w?si=7AYNCYd0bSYDGLQQ","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55168,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/some-troubles-with-reading-through-bore/497027/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3569463,"name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","username":"kingc95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T19:59:20.809Z","cooked":"

How is it wired to the RoboRio? Can you upload a picture of the wiring? Final question which way is the encoders switch set to? It’s either index/relative (S mode is not actually usable per rev) or absolute not both at once it seems both relative and absolute the encoder stays switched on A mode.

Edit: sorry @jom if I sniped you with my editing

Rzheng1232:

Currently it is set as A

Documented as correct.

Switch Options
There is a switch on the side of the encoder and with two options: ‘A’ and ‘S’. ‘A’ is the ABI encoder output mode which outputs the incremental and absolute encoder signals. ‘S’ is the SSI/SPI mode used in the manufacturing stage and potential future features. Currently, only the ‘A’ mode is supported. Make sure that the switch is in the ‘A’ position when using this encoder.

Ok, thank you guys for the help. We switched the encoder from A to S and back to A, and power cycled the robot a few times, and eventually it worked again. I’m still not sure why this is happening, but it seems fixed… for now.
